title: Noncommutative Synchrotron
abstract: We study the synchrotron radiation in noncommutative electrodynamics at first order in theta. There are two main results. On the theoretical side, we find an acausal behavior for the electromagnetic field in the form of time-derivatives higher than two. This effect naturally arises even if only theta^(12) is different from zero, and is due to the presence in the theory of two different speeds of light. On the phenomenological side, we find that the synchrotron radiation is a very promising candidate to search for experimental evidences of the effects of noncommutativity or, conversely, to establish tight bounds on the magnitude of theta.
